title: Understanding Overdraft Protection Options
content:
Explain overdraft protection options to customers:

1. Standard Overdraft Coverage:
   - Covers checks, ACH transactions, and automatic payments
   - $35 fee per transaction (maximum 6 fees per day)
   - Must opt-in for debit card and ATM overdrafts

2. Overdraft Protection Transfer:
   - Links checking account to savings, money market, or credit card
   - Automatic transfer when account would overdraft
   - $10 transfer fee (less than overdraft fee)
   - Must maintain minimum balance in backup account

3. Overdraft Line of Credit:
   - Credit line attached to checking account
   - Interest charges only on amount used
   - Requires credit application and approval
   - $5 annual fee, prime + 3% interest rate

4. No overdraft coverage:
   - Transactions are declined if insufficient funds
   - No fees for declined transactions
   - May still incur fees for returned checks

5. Setting up protection:
   - Can be done online, by phone, or in branch
   - Changes take effect within 1-2 business days
   - Customer can modify or cancel anytime

Reminder: Explain reg E rights regarding debit card overdrafts.
